comments.commentBody:
The only answer with North Korea is to work with China, Russia, South Korea, Japan and whomever in developing a plan to take out Kim and his regime militarily. It can't just be the US going alone. While sure, we could easily do this alone, we need China and Russia to be assured that this is not in attempt to maneuver against them. This is the only way to deal with North Korea. Not through cyber warfare, but real warfare. Not just through air attacks hoping people will then rise up to over throw the regime - the people are starving and too weak to do this. Troops will need to be on the ground. It shouldn't just be American troops either. This is truly an international effort.

Pacifism for North Korea will never work. The sooner we work with China, Russia, South Korea and Japan to agree to deal with this threat militarily the better we off. If I could trade the wars of Libya, Iraq, Yemen, Somalia, Syria, Afghanistan for any other war..it would be North Korea. They are the real threat to global security and peace. Sadly, I'm not sure if Trump is capable of building a coalition with China, Russia et al however hopefully he can try. That said, for this war I much rather a more competent president however at the same time.. the sooner we deal with North Korea the better.

Because:

1) this information is not classified.
2) it is valuable to the proper functioning of a self-governing society.
3) we are not at war with North Korea.
4) this is not a “legitimate and non-newsworthy” government secret.
5) since Trump ignores intelligence, the only way to brief him is through the press.

I feel strange saying this, but this is one war we need to fight, and conventionally, before Kim forces it nuclearly. The regime has to go, no matter what the Chinese or Russians think. And it will take boots on the ground and American deaths. But this maniacal bunch will eventually overlay their hands and force a catastrophe on a population center here. Carthage must be destroyed. And this comes from a dedicated opponent of the Vietnam and Iraq wars.

A far, far bigger threat to world peace is having a narcissistic clown in charge of the largest working nuclear arsenal. While kicking in the face every ally. While accepting bribes and covert support from every foe of the free world.
Even if North Korea were to do anything with its limited arsenal, the results would be horrible, but still contained. If, however, the US disintegrates, leaving place to hundreds of Kims and Donalds each with a couple nukes, then we are really facing extinction.
It is time that the US gets its act together, and restarts a unifying approach to the world.
Paying its dues to the UN and preserving the climate are just the first two steps in the right direction.
Working with the Chinese, Japanese and South Korea to present North Korea with an alternative they just have to like, because it works for everybody, will be the next step.

It has been said that doing the same thing over and over again while expecting a different result is madness. I wish politicians would learn from what doesn't work and try something new. If we already know that Kim is afraid of us and that makes him buckle down and act out, why oh why do we insist parading war ships in formation with South Korea in front of Kim's nose? What is being gained by this? Such display of force only exacerbates his fear. He then launches more missiles, we then impose more sanctions, then, more North Korean citizens die of hunger. And back to square one.

For heaven's sake, is there anybody among diplomats who can talk to this guy or are we to believe Dennis Rodman is supernaturally gifted with a silver tongue?

Oh, I forgot, the State Department is being dismantled as we speak...

This is a really bad time for our country to be represented by a mentally unstable clown in the White House, with a Darth Vader standing behind him whispering sweet words of nihilism.

When is the GOP going to wake up from their drunken stupor (drunk from new found unexpected power, that is) and take control of a situation that has the potential to spiral out of control real fast and real devastatingly?

It's already being done with atmospheric balloons on the North South border. What little that had been sent over the border never fails to anger the north and is very controversial in the south where a lot of people had wanted to improve relations.

Either you don't understand that all technology is not created equal PISonny, or you choose not to. Hacking into the DNC server, gathering a bunch of e-mails sitting on a server and then deliberately leaking them over time to selectively undermine the Clinton campaign is orders of magnitude easier than hacking into a country's nuclear military apparatus and attempting to surreptitiously undermine it from inside.

And let's see how Trump handles North Korea instead of living in the past, looking back at what former President, now private citizen, Obama did as in some bizarre way validating Trump's unimpressive and scandal ridden first 40+ days.

I like your analysis.
Except: The guy is paranoid. And as a corollary, he is surrounded by other psychopaths. Nobody else would want to spend their lives within the circle of death he has created.
So no, I do not believe any deal will work with the guy.

I would offer him a nice home in exile. After we manage to build a coalition that he cannot ignore. That is difficult, but far more realistic.

We live in an increasing complex world and we have elected a President that can't cope with more than 140 characters at a time. North Korea will require extreme care and diplomacy, which Trump lacks. When will the Republican's wake up to the fact that this man is mentally challenged and not capable of being President.

The Armistice was not a peace treaty or agreement ending the Korea war.  North and South Korea are technically still at war and thus explains why North Korea behaves the way that it does and pursuing nuclear weapons despite economic sanctions, political isolation and the hardships endured by its people.  The North Korea leadership is not irrational.  What they want most is regime and political survival and preservation.  Until a peace treaty or agreement is formally agreed to by North and South Korea and their respective allies, China and the US, North Korea will continue to serve the national interests of both China and the US.

This problem predated Obama. North Korea has been developing its nuclear capabilities since the late 60s. It signed the Nuclear Proliferation Treaty in 1985 In 1992 it signed the IAEA safeguards agreement but denied access to nuclear waste sites in 1993. It's been game on since then. Presidents since George H W Bush have been trying to deal with the Korean problem with little success.

There is simply no problem because our own Dear Leader has simply told us, "It won't happen!" That's the end of it. No? Until we hear: "Nobody knew dealing with North Korea could be so complicated."
Perhaps this will make some Trump voters realize, we really need someone in the White House who is stable and has the judgment and knowledgeable enough to deal with nuclear issues. We can but hope.

Trumps lacks both the intelligence and subtlety necessary for dealing with a situation as complicated as this. He has already insulted the Chinese, to the extent that they are wasting no time to match Trump's plans to increase defense spending.

His recklessness will bring us close to war eventually, and he should hope that he is impeached, because there are surely a lot of individuals in the intelligence agencies who know a way to escort him out.

The "mitigating" factor is not China. There are at least two major problems with your proposal: 1) As this article clearly states, "Getting timely intelligence on the location of North Korea’s leaders or their weapons at any moment would be almost impossible." 2) Whoever succeeds Kim may very well turn out to be even worse, and China can't guarantee who the successor will be. Those are the real problems with your suggestion.

Another act of avoidance on uncomfortable subject of Russia. Trump really has no imagination, but again, this will probably work on his target audience. The only answer imo is to continue raising standards of education across US on federal level and hold states accountable, younger American students already faring better than 10 or 20 yrs ago, but it seems, with todays trends we have to be on the constant defense of our kids future. Indeed, sad
If the name was changed to Trumpcare, the argument would end immediately!
Just when you thought it was safe to come out. H-e-s-s back.

Many years ago, when I was a law enforcement officer, the "higher-ups" sent around an anonymous survey for us to complete. I saw a colleague of mine completing his while wearing latex hospital gloves while he filled it out. I asked him why he was wearing the gloves.

He told me that I shouldn't believe this survey was "anonymous."

"They" he continued, "would know who completed the surveys by dusting them for fingerprints."

A couple of years later he was found unfit for the necessary security clearance, and was pensioned off.
So, we can now add Paranoid Personality Disorder to the diagnosis. I keep hoping to wake up from this nightmare--it was entertaining, for a day or two!
Isn't the NSA recording everything? I thought it was all being saved in some ginormous hard-drive deep in the bowels of some fog-shrouded mountain somewhere?

Further evidence that the man is delusional.

Sad, so sad.

45 loves the limbo.
He just can't go low enough.
Our current president is slowly becoming unhinged.

My guess is that the Obama Administration did tap his phones...along with every other security organization on the planet.

This story is a non starter.
Dark times indeed.  With a dark and delusional person occupying our highest elected office.
